column3: Greetings, \x02\x08\x15\xe9\x05\xff\tMistress\xff\x07Master\x03 \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x03\x03. How may I be of assistance?
Praise Halone that Master Alphinaud and Mistress Tataru did not come to harm... Ah, pardon me. Is there aught you require?

Oh, you are still here, \x02\x08\x15\xe9\x05\xff\tMistress\xff\x07Master\x03 \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x03\x03? I was under the impression you had already embarked upon your journey. Do you require assistance?
Full glad am I to see the chaos in our streets quelled. For a time, we feared it might spread into the Pillars...
I...I am sorry, \x02\x08\x15\xe9\x05\xff\tMistress\xff\x07Master\x03 \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x03\x03, but I cannot...

Pray forgive me my earlier behavior, \x02\x08\x15\xe9\x05\xff\tMistress\xff\x07Master\x03 \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x03\x03. I know full well we have not the time to wallow in sadness.
You are for the western lands once more, yes? I shall pray for your safe return.
In times such as these, I daresay there is little I can do to assist you. Nevertheless, if you require assistance, pray ask.
And so a new day dawns on our fair city...

My lord the count is considering writing a chronicle of recent events, while the details are still fresh within his mind. I pray he does, for the people should know the price which was paid for this peace.
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
Tell me about House Fortemps.
Tell me about Ishgard.
Nothing.
Me? Why, I am but a humble steward sworn to House Fortemps.
I doubt you wish to hear the minutiae of my duties. Simply put, at the behest of my lord the count, I manage household affairs.
I have served at his pleasure for more than fifty years, and by the Fury's grace, I shall serve for fifty more.
The origins of House Fortemps can be traced back to King Thordan and his knights twelve. Ours was one of the four founding houses of Ishgard.
Accordingly, our interests extend far beyond the walls of the city proper. Camp Dragonhead, for instance, is our responsibility.
As for the family... You have of course met my lord Count Edmont de Fortemps, who is the head of our house.
His two sons, my lords Artoirel and Emmanellain, are next in line\xe2\x94\x80may the Fury watch over and keep them from harm.

As for those sworn to House Fortemps... In addition to the knights, squires, and infantry, more than a hundred craftsmen, retainers, and other servants possessed of notable skill are pledged to our service.
Given our strong position, one might expect us to have no truck with foreign merchants and sellswords. However, nothing could be further from the truth.

I should think that my lord the count was quite clear on this point, but it was our hope that you and your allies would, by your deeds, help us to convince the other High Houses of the wisdom in opening the Gates of Judgement to all\xe2\x94\x80among other things.
More than anything else, though, I suspect he saw in you potential...
More than one thousand years ago, Halone appeared before King Thordan I and bade him lead his people to the Promised Land\xe2\x94\x80to the lands we now call home.
And so the king and his knights twelve did as was commanded. They came to Coerthas to found a great kingdom in the Fury's name.

But the great wyrm Nidhogg would not have it so. With hatred in his heart, Nidhogg sought out King Thordan. In the ensuing battle, the king and half his knights were slain, but his son Haldrath rallied the others and drove back the fell beast.
Thus did the war between our peoples begin\xe2\x94\x80the war between dragon and man.
For one thousand years, Ishgard has stood against the Horde, and not once were our defenses breached...until the day Lady Iceheart's allies shattered our wards on the Steps of Faith.
Though the wyverns were slain before they could breach our defenses here, those in Foundation were not so fortunate. Unarmed men, women, and even children were made to feel the Dravanians' wrath.
Walls can be rebuilt, but lives lost can never be reclaimed. My lord the count knows this all too well...
These are...unprecedented times for Ishgard. I fear truths long held sacrosanct will not be so easily discarded.
Only time will tell if we have the strength to endure what is to come.
Yet if we do not, it will not be for lack of effort. My lord the count and Ser Aymeric are not ones to sit idle.
dummy
